Posts.Content: faithmena4 wrote: Hello Ladies, Has anyone been able to obtain long term disability insurance even though us Stage 4 Metsters are considered having a pre existing condition or has anyone been able to revoke a denied claim.Unfortunately I was under impression I was covered but now realize that I will not be getting LTD and must now revaluate my situation. I am very fortunate that I would be able to work from home during the "chemo phases" but still reeling from all the hard cold facts that come along with this diagnoses. We are certainly treated like second class citizens when it comes to cancer and monetary support.  Dx 1/13/2005, 1cm, Stage IV, Grade 3, 0/1 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Pre existing condition faithmena4 Brendatrue

Posts.Content: Apr 4, 2009 01:18PM faithmena4 wrote: Well according to my health plan when you apply for new health care ( private insurance) if you have been diagnosed with cancer you are considered with a pre existing condition and will not be ensured for it. I was laid off my last job , found a new one and now have to deal with not having LTD on this new health plan. I am not sure if I would  still working for the same company and had a recurrence what that would mean.
Posts.Title: Pre existing condition faithmena4 Brendatrue

Posts.Content: May 12, 2009 10:05PM faithmena4 wrote: I am in agreement that stress played a major role. I had gone through some very stressful situations. Divorce,losing a job,moving to a different country,financial stress, however this does not explain how some of us are prone and others are not effected.  Just like how some cancer patients using alternatives methods work while for others it fails. Is it just a crap shoot at the end of the day? Fate maybe? mena
Posts.Title: Has cancer pshycological roots? vivo bygracealone

Posts.Content: May 26, 2009 05:02AM faithmena4 wrote: I have just been through the exact same thing you are describing , however I was on TCH. As symptoms got worse, I could not even just lie down in bed without waiting first for my breathing to calm down,I went to see my Onc. Turns out I had a pleural effusion and severe water retention. He put me on Prednisone and Lasix. It has helped tremedously, however still feel a little shortness when I walk. As all the ladies mentioned I agree that you must follow up with your Doc asap.
Posts.Title: Heart Racing/Shortness of Breath stayingstrong Alpal

Posts.Content: Apr 8, 2009 10:47AM faithmena4 wrote: I can completely relate. I am doing same regimen just got no 8 in my body. It really did kick my butt as well....5.6 and 7 were absolutely unbearable extreme fatigue along with body pain, constant eye tearing, fluid retention, metal mouth not being able to walk. It seems this go round I am doing much better Doc prescribed Prednisone seems to be helping. Hang in there . My heart goes out to you but you are not alone. Blessings.

Posts.Title: Sunday Truth, CMF, and Forever Skyrat Skyrat

Posts.Content: Feb 7, 2009 08:17AM faithmena4 wrote: Floridalady my heart go out to you , I would be very angry as well. For the life of me I don't understand where all the money goes? It's been years and years......billions in research. It's just mind boggling......!!!!!!! I have a close friend who is triple neg as well and every time the fear of a recurrence comes up for her she always says "Yes but I am not like you there is nothing they can offer me." If today I would be facing the same situation but I would be triple neg it would be very very difficult. I am so sorry that you must endure this and I truly hope that more funds will be diverted and more attention be paid to triple neg bc cancers. I understand your frustration. God Bless you and keep you strong to fight this awful disease we stage iv gals face. Mena
Posts.Title: Man on Moon, Obama President, Cure for Cancer TripleNeg Mamie2

Posts.Content: Apr 9, 2009 01:05AM faithmena4 wrote: Hi Abby, I have to psych myself up for 12 treatments total of Carboplatin and Taxotere...I am having very good results so I guess that is encouraging even though it has really truly kicked my butt.  I am also getting Herceptin which I understand has some good results too. Are you Her2 nue? As far as metal mouth what I find helped me was cantaloupe - I ate tons!! Delmonti fruit popcicles- and oranges - that was about it... every thing else had a weird taste - oh and sometimes adding jalepeno to make the dish spicy helped me too....we must eat it's important. Hang in there girl.....
Posts.Title: tax and carbo kicked my but! abbyglp faithmena4

Posts.Content: Dec 3, 2008 09:59AM faithmena4 wrote: I have just started my Taxotere,Carboplatin and Herceptin regime. My first round was a little rough I did have the very dry mouth metal taste and all over fatigue for about three days. I have just recvd my second dosage (every three weeks) and this time was a breeze. I don't have any of the initial side effects except for Monday I felt pretty tired. If it continues this way , it will be very doable. As far as the nail coming off - they put my finger tips in ice water along with ice slippers on my feet for the duration of Taxotere treatment to prevent them from falling off...little uncomfortable but again doable. Mena

Posts.Content: Jan 5, 2009 06:24AM faithmena4 wrote: Hello, My naturopath recommended I try this prior to my chemo treatment, it is fantastic for immune system and cancer prevention however she did say that lots of Oncologists do not want patients taking it along with treatment as it may mess with the chemo. I decided to wait for a chemo break as my Onc is very conservative and did not approve.  Mena
